actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-47, by Mr. Beilenson.

Upon adoption of this resolution, the requirement for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House shall be waived with respect to a resolution reported on the legislative day of March 31, 1993, providing for consideration of aa conference report to accompany H. Con. Res. 64.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 24.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 171 (Roll no. 124).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of a certain resolution reported from the Committee on Rules.

summary.text: Waives, with respect to any resolution reported by the Committee on Rules on March 31, 1993, to provide for the consideration of the conference report on H. Con. Res. 64 (congressional budget), provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from such committee on the same day it is presented to the House.

titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of a certain resolution reported from the Committee on Rules.
